text: it has been raining here overnight we've
had torrential downpours you can see the
result here everything is now swamped in
this stinking black water and there's
more rain coming the fact is that maybe
80 to 90% of the buildings along the
coast here and loft their roofs so even
where the buildings have survived people
are effectively living in the open in
all this rain then of course the other
big thing now is food look at this line
this line stretches for hundreds of
meters in both directions
everybody lining up here pretty
patiently it's going to talk to some of
them hello there how are you so what are
you waiting what are you doing here
we're waiting for rice are you hungry
when I do have any food no food when did
you eat did you eat today
you ate today yes
this is this is the really big issue now
here is people lost all of their food or
their rice was damaged in the storm it's
now the fifth day since the storm
supplies are running out you can see the
results there's still a sense that aid
is not getting in here the airport there
are planes coming in but we don't see
any of it here the situation is becoming
more and more tense more and more hunger
people are getting increasingly
desperate
